body: This was exactly what I needed to get started! The installation steps were clear and I was up and running in 5 minutes.
Great introduction! One question - does Claude Code work offline or does it require internet connection?
I've been using Copilot but this looks more powerful for complex tasks. Going to try it today.
The CLAUDE.md tip is gold! I didn't realize how important project context was.
Thanks for the tutorial. Shared this with my team.
The prompting examples are incredibly helpful. I was definitely in the 'vague prompt' category before reading this.
Chain of thought prompting has changed my debugging sessions completely. Great tip!
Could you share more examples of negative prompting? I find that technique really useful.
I printed out the 'Good Prompt' example and stuck it on my monitor. Reminder to be specific!
MCP is a game changer. Being able to query my database directly while Claude helps with code is amazing.
Is there a list of all available MCP servers somewhere? Would love to explore more options.
The read-only tip for production databases is crucial. Almost made that mistake!
We've integrated AI review into our PR process. Review times dropped by 50%.
I was skeptical about AI code review but it catches things I miss when I'm tired. Now I use it for every PR.
The 'AI for first pass, humans for final say' approach makes so much sense.
I used to spend 10 minutes writing commit messages. Now it takes 10 seconds.
The conventional commits format is enforced automatically. My git history has never looked cleaner.
PR generation is my favorite feature. It even suggests reviewers based on the code touched!
Understanding context windows helped me work with our large monorepo effectively. Great explanation!
The tip about focused sessions vs trying to do everything at once was exactly what I needed to hear.
Finally an honest comparison! I use both Claude Code and Copilot together and they complement each other well.
I switched from Cursor after reading this. No regrets - the multi-file editing is superior.
Good point about them not being mutually exclusive. Using the right tool for the right job.
Our team has built 20+ custom commands now. Total game changer for consistency.
The $ARGUMENTS feature is brilliant. Makes commands so flexible.
Sharing commands via git is perfect. New team members get all our workflows automatically.
The 'test the behavior not implementation' advice fixed my AI-generated tests completely.
60-80% useful after refinement sounds about right. Still a massive time saver.
TDD with AI is exactly how I work now. Write failing test, let Claude fix it.
The debugging workflow with MCP integration is powerful. Found a prod issue in 5 minutes.
Including full error messages makes such a difference. Claude can actually help when it has context.
I always start complex tasks in Plan Mode now. Saves so much time.
The 'explore then execute' workflow makes total sense. Wish I'd learned this earlier.
Our CLAUDE.md went from empty to 200 lines. Project context is everything.
The memory hierarchy explanation cleared up my confusion. Great article!
Running /init on joining a project is now my first step. Essential.
We have a legacy module nobody understood. AI helped us document and modernize it safely.
The characterization tests tip is gold. Capture current behavior before changing anything.
Finding orphaned data with MongoDB MCP saved us from a production bug. Amazing!
The read-only connection warning needs to be in bold. So important!
Generated docs are 80% there. Quick edits and they're production ready.
The auto-generated changelog from PR changes is brilliant. Never thought of that.
Understanding the difference between Commands, Skills, and SubAgents finally clicked. Great explanation!
The Plan SubAgent is incredibly powerful for large features. Use it every day.
Used this guide to roll out Claude Code to our 20-person team. Went smoothly!
The 'addressing concerns' table is perfect for convincing skeptical managers.
We added AI review as a non-blocking CI step. Great suggestion!
Rate limits are real. Had to implement caching for CI usage.
The 'what edge cases might cause issues' prompt found 3 bugs in my code. Wow.
Defensive programming tips are excellent. My error handling improved significantly.
Love the honest journey perspective. Week 3 is where it really clicked for me too.
Your 'mind blown' moment with the multi-file editing was exactly my experience!
Shared this with my team's skeptics. Real experiences help more than marketing.
TypeScript really does make AI assistance better. Types give so much context.
The type error fixing workflow is my favorite. Claude understands the type system perfectly.
Security section should be mandatory reading. Almost shared API keys in a prompt once.
The emergency response section is crucial. Rotate keys immediately if exposed!
Shared with our security team. They added this to our onboarding docs.
Explore agent was perfect for onboarding to a new project. Understood the codebase in an hour.
The tracing flows prompt is exactly what I needed. Understanding request paths is much easier now.
I use both Cursor and Claude Code now. Best of both worlds.
The comparison table is super helpful. Finally understand where each tool shines.
Real bug case studies are so valuable. This is exactly how debugging with AI works.
The memory leak case study saved me. Had the exact same issue!
15 minutes vs 2 hours for that first bug? That's the productivity gain we need to show management.
# syntax is such a simple but useful feature. Use it multiple times per session.
Quick notes for temporary context is genius. No more repeating myself.
Python tips are just as relevant as the TypeScript ones. Great cross-language advice.
The FastAPI examples are perfect. Exact patterns I use daily.
NestJS patterns article is exactly what I needed. Claude generates perfect module structures now.
Guards and decorators generation is flawless when you reference existing patterns.
Context7 for NestJS documentation is amazing. Real-time docs lookup while coding!
Didn't know about all the available documentation. Going to explore more.
Mode comparison table is bookmarked. Reference it constantly.
Plan Mode first, then decide on edit mode. Perfect workflow.
Auto-edit mode is scary but so fast. Use it for low-risk changes.
Angular tips are spot on! The RxJS refactoring prompts are exactly right.
NgRx state management generation is incredible. Boilerplate in seconds.
Ethics discussion is important. We need more content like this in the AI space.
The 'AI augments, doesn't replace' message needs to be repeated more often.
Transparency with team is key. We all know who uses AI and share techniques.
Speed optimization tips made my AI sessions 3x faster. Especially batch related tasks!
Keyboard shortcuts list is printed on my desk. Muscle memory developing!
I made almost every mistake on this list when I started. Great learning resource!
Blind trust was my biggest mistake. Now I review everything, even if it looks right.
Fear of experimentation held me back. Branches make it safe to push limits.
Personal workflow article resonated with me. Everyone finds their own style.
The Speed Runner workflow is me! Auto-edit for everything trusted.
QA perspective on AI is valuable. Test generation has improved our coverage significantly.
Bug analysis prompts are perfect. Our bug reports are more structured now.
Technical debt management with AI is underrated. This approach really works.
The debt log in CLAUDE.md is brilliant. Visible and trackable.
Pair programming with AI is my new normal. Always have a partner now.
The human advantage section is important. We bring things AI can't.
Rubber duck + expert is the perfect description. AI listens AND responds helpfully.
DevOps integration examples are exactly what I needed. Terraform generation is amazing.
The K8s manifests generation saved me hours. Perfect structure every time.
Troubleshooting with Datadog MCP is the dream. Context from monitoring while coding.
Great vision for the future! Excited about what's coming.
The 'what won't change' section is reassuring. Human skills remain essential.
Preparing now for the future of AI development. Great roadmap!
The best code will be written by humans and AI together. Perfect closing thought.
Just started using Claude Code yesterday. This article series is exactly what I needed.
Coming back to this article after a month of use. The advice holds up perfectly.
We've built 5 custom MCPs now. The extensibility is incredible.
